newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: U.N. designates Austrian palace a heritage site.
newsitem.headline: U.N. designates Austrian palace a heritage site.

text.p: Austria's historic Schoenbrunn Palace, the former summer residence of Austro-Hungarian emperors, has been designated a world heritage site by the U.N. cultural agency, a U.N. official said on Wednesday.

From September, the yellow-coloured baroque palace and its gardens will rank alongside India's Taj Mahal and the Egyptian pyramids as one of the world's most prized cultural spots, the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) said.
The Alpine city of Salzburg, birthplace of Mozart and home to a prestigious annual music festival, will also be included on the list from September.
